newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turk PM gives brass the slip for Friday prayers.
newsitem.headline: Turk PM gives brass the slip for Friday prayers.

text.p: Islamist Prime Minister Necmettin Erbakan underscored his independence from the secularist military on Friday, breaking away from an official air force ceremony to perform Moslem noon prayers.

State-run Anatolian news agency said Erbakan, modern Turkey's first Islamist leader, slipped out from a ceremony attended by military chief Ismail Hakki Karadayi to pray in a mosque at the Merzifon air base in northern Turkey.
"Prime Minister Erbakan did not take part in the presentation of the squadron," the agency said.
Erbakan, Karadayi and President Suleyman Demirel had earlier attended a parade for newly modernised F-16 jets.
The military has mosques on its bases mainly for the use of lower ranks. Members of the fiercely secularist officer corps are discouraged from worshipping openly.
Erbakan has stalled on putting a planned anti-Islamist crackdown into motion, despite intense pressure from the army that has shaken his coalition government.
